intro: Sampera, commonly known as the "milkweed of the Caribbean," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with toxic properties. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Its milky sap, which is latex-like, contains cardiac glycosides and is used in traditional medicine. Sampera is often found in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or disturbed soils.
